chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Jacob James Braun was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If probation is revoked, all conditions of probation will apply to extended supervision.

miscConds.notes:
1) The defendant must provide DNA and pay the surcharge; the analysis may be expunged upon application to the Department of Justice. 
2) If the defendant completes 17 hours of community service and provides proof to the DOC within 1 year from sentencing, all but the DNA surcharge will be waived.
3) The defendant shall pay at a minimum rate of $25 per month through probation.  Payments should first be applied to DNA surcharges.
4) If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Defendant shall not use or possess firearms for life.

1) The defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety; no use or possession of any illegal drugs, paraphernalia, or controlled substances without a valid prescription. 
2) Defendant shall not vote in any election until their civil rights are restored.
The defendant shall maintain gainful employment or pursue higher education.

1) The defendant shall continue to follow his mental health regimen and take all medications as they are prescribed to him.
2) The defendant shall undergo regular drug testing.

charges.descr: Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jacob James Braun

records.addlTxt: JOC returned

1:30 PM Defendant Jacob James Braun in court.  Attorney Alysja Otten in court for Jacob James Braun.  Attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for State of Wisconsin. Case is on for Sentencing Hearing.  State reviews PD's sentencing memo.  Parties acknowledge receipt of PSI, propose no corrections or modifications.  State assures VR compliance.  State argues for 3 yrs probation, imposed stayed 1 yr IC and 2 yrs ES.  Defense attorney argues for probation with a withheld sentence.  Defendant makes a statement.  
Court orders:
3 yrs probation; 1 yr IC and 2 yrs ES imposed and stayed
Conditions:
No use or possession of any illegal drugs, paraphernalia, or controlled substances without a valid prescription. The defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety. Gainful employment or continued education. Continue to follow mental health regimen and take all medications as prescribed.  Regular drug testing.  Firearms and voting prohibitions.  $518 court costs, court willing to waive up to $268 costs. If def does 17 hours of community service and provides proof to the court within 1 year from sentencing, all but the DNA surcharge will be waived/forgiven.  $25/ month payments to probation.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  If revoked, eligible for SAP and CIP.
Appeal rights provided. Defendant shall provide DNA and fingerprints prior to leaving the building.
Sentencing Memorandum- defense
Letter of support

11:55 AM Defendant Jacob James Braun appeared by video.  Attorney  in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Alysja Otten in court for Jacob James Braun. Case is on for Plea Hearing. Def waives in person appearance.  Agreement is recited by Attorney Otten.  Def will plead guilty to Class I Felony Operating W/O Owner's consent, DA will amend complaint to 943.23(3)(a), cap what they recommend at PSI recommendation.  Rest is free to argue.  Mr. Rennicke makes formal motion to amend.  Court so orders. 
Court asks def if they understand the agreement.  Def does.  Court reviews Def's constitutional rights.  Def understands that def is waiving those rights by entering into agreement today.  Court asks Def if they understand Court is not bound by agreement, and could order maximum penalties.  Def understands.  Court asks for plea. 
 Def enters a plea of Guilty.  Court finds def is making plea knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily.  Court finds a factual basis to accept the plea.  Court finds defendant guilty of  Operating a Motor Vehicle without Owner;s Consent and orders a JOC.  State is in compliance with Victim's rights.  Court orders PSI, long form, agent does not need to appear.  Def. is ordered to cooperate w/Agent.  Def. updates address/phone.  Bond continues.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

03:04 PM Called 22CF41 for PH.  Defendant Jacob James Braun in court with Attorney Alysja Otten, who appears in person.  Defendant in custody, appears from Pine County jail by video.  DA James Jay Rennicke appeared for State of Wisconsin in person.  Def asks court to appear by video, granted, def waiving in person appearance.  Case is on for preliminary hearing.  State calls first witness, Deputy Joshua Henry, who is sworn in by the clerk and testifies.  Witness has identified the defendant.  Venue is made.  Attny Otten questions Deputy Henry. No further questions.  State would rest and ask for bind over.  Witness steps down.  Attny Otten has no witness.  State presents argument.  Attny Otten has no argument.  Court finds probable cause that a crime probably has been committed and the defendant probably committed it.  The matter is bound over for further proceedings.  The State files information. Attny Otten will proceed with ARGN if motions preserved until next status, court grants.   Case on for Arraignment.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, def. waives reading.  Court informs def. of charges, possible penalties and rights.  NG plea entered to all counts. Def to let Attny know address once released.  Status conference scheduled for May 26, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Notice of Hearing returned "Attempted - Not Known"

Court orders $1500 signature bond, no contact with the victim or their residence.  Form to be sent to Pine for signature.  Def to waive personal appearance.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 20, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
